definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們總是調皮搗蛋尋開心。

sentences.english: We pissed our teacher off again today, horsing around and acting up.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們調皮搗蛋，又把老師給惹怒了。

sentences.english: Bad: There is always a bad apple in every class.
sentences.chinese: 每個班級都有一個調皮搗蛋的學生。

sentences.english: Lavish on the love and hugs and strokes when she isn't into mischief.
sentences.chinese: 當她不調皮搗蛋時給她足夠的愛，擁抱和撫摸。

sentences.english: The children have been acting up all evening.
sentences.chinese: 整個晚上孩子們都在調皮搗蛋。

sentences.english: A rowdy kid like that is just the kind that parents dote on .
sentences.chinese: 做父母所寵愛的，正是這種調皮搗蛋的孩子。

sentences.english: He chuckled at the child's mischievousness.
sentences.chinese: 他對這個小孩的調皮搗蛋低聲輕笑。

definition: to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
